text: RT @Feargal_Sharkey: So @AnglianWater have been breaching their discharge permit on the River Cam since 2015. And the @EnvAgency does what‚Ä¶

RT @Withampiscator: Any further news on the Price/ #RiverLugg ecocidal bank & dredging work investigation/prosecution? #roguefarmers
@Salmo‚Ä¶

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I wonder how much of the work actually carried out here was done by the EA? They do partnerships poorly. I expect the vast majority of the work they cite would have been "delivered as "outcomes" by River Trusts and Conservation bodies. Smoke & mirrors.

@SalmonTroutCons @envagencymids @envagency @Feargal_Sharkey @PrivateEyeNews @naturalengland @forestrycomm @davethroupea @hfdscouncil @wildlifetrusts @herefordtimes

@MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Overall am impressed with their determination & passion. Some of our most innovative & successful conservationists started with breeding animals in their back gardens - Gerald Durrell & Carl Jones to name two. I hope these lads get the support and guidance they deserve.

urls.title: What do you think of this? - Mark Avery
urls.description: Who doesn‚Äô t love a turtle? asks the headline. Quite a few to judge from the reception this piece got on social media. Two lads planning to make money out of captive breeding reptiles and amphibians and with an ambition to reintroduce herptiles to the UK ‚Äì quite a few of them. When I was their age I didn‚Äô t have this much gumption! All reintroductions need to be carefully thought through of course ‚Äì and there are laws involved too. But the thing that strikes me about this is that it is another of a

text:
RT @MarkAvery: What do you think of this? https://t.co/vDHUGfFSLa

@CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland‚Ä¶

urls.title: Save the River Cam with Feargal Sharkey
urls.description: The River Cam is dying. Its treasured feeder chalk streams, a natural wonder of the UK, are being killed by over-abstraction. Hear punk legend Feargal Sharke...

text: People are fed up with their rivers being plundered by water companies and a supine @EnvAgency - see https://t.co/LZoTHB3hPm https://t.co/HIWODPTWkc

urls.title: From no mobility to future mobility: Where COVID-19 has accelerated change
urls.description: COVID-19 has disrupted mobility and its effect will linger well into next year. How will changing consumer preferences, technologies, and regulations shape future mobility?

urls.title: What do you think of this? - Mark Avery
urls.description: Who doesn‚Äô t love a turtle? asks the headline. Quite a few to judge from the reception this piece got on social media. Two lads planning to make money out of captive breeding reptiles and amphibians and with an ambition to reintroduce herptiles to the UK ‚Äì quite a few of them. When I was their age I didn‚Äô t have this much gumption! All reintroductions need to be carefully thought through of course ‚Äì and there are laws involved too. But the thing that strikes me about this is that it is another of a

text: RT @tuinz07: WWT continues to recruit. We are looking for a Wetland Project Manager to join our team in creating climate resilient wetlands‚Ä¶

The @EnvAgency are useless example 5,752.

In 2020 the EA set themselves a target of "Enhancing", 2,300km of rivers. A meaningless term much loved by the board.

They achieved 1,753km. So by their measurement they missed a totally made up, completely fatuous objective.

Ho hum. https://t.co/EBi3jF0k68
